trans-unit.source: .NET Core Samples
trans-unit.target: .NET Core Samples

trans-unit.source: This folder contains all the sample code that is part of any topic under the .NET Core documentation.
trans-unit.target: This folder contains all the sample code that is part of any topic under the .NET Core documentation.

trans-unit.source: There are several different projects that are organized in sub-folders.
trans-unit.target: There are several different projects that are organized in sub-folders.

trans-unit.source: These sub-folders are organized similar to the organization of the docs for .NET Core.
trans-unit.target: These sub-folders are organized similar to the organization of the docs for .NET Core.

trans-unit.source: Some of the articles will have more than one sample associated with them.
trans-unit.target: Some of the articles will have more than one sample associated with them.

trans-unit.source: The readme.md file for each sample will refer to the article so that you can read more about the concepts covered in each sample.
trans-unit.target: The readme.md file for each sample will refer to the article so that you can read more about the concepts covered in each sample.

trans-unit.source: Building a sample
trans-unit.target: Building a sample

trans-unit.source: You build the samples using the .NET CLI.
trans-unit.target: You build the samples using the .NET CLI.

trans-unit.source: You can download the CLI from [the .NET Core home page](http://microsoft.com/net/core).
trans-unit.target: You can download the CLI from [the .NET Core home page](http://microsoft.com/net/core).

trans-unit.source: Then, execute these commands from the CLI in the directory of any sample:
trans-unit.target: Then, execute these commands from the CLI in the directory of any sample:

trans-unit.source: These will install any needed dependencies, build the project, and run the project respectively.
trans-unit.target: These will install any needed dependencies, build the project, and run the project respectively.

trans-unit.source: Multi-project samples have instructions in their root directory in a `README.md` file.
trans-unit.target: Multi-project samples have instructions in their root directory in a `README.md` file.

trans-unit.source: Except where noted, all samples will build from the command line, on any platform supported by .NET Core.
trans-unit.target: Except where noted, all samples will build from the command line, on any platform supported by .NET Core.

trans-unit.source: There are a few samples that are specific to Visual Studio, and will require Visual Studio 2015 Update 3 or a newer version.
trans-unit.target: There are a few samples that are specific to Visual Studio, and will require Visual Studio 2015 Update 3 or a newer version.

trans-unit.source: In addition, some samples show platform specific features, and will require a specific platform.
trans-unit.target: In addition, some samples show platform specific features, and will require a specific platform.

trans-unit.source: Creating new samples
trans-unit.target: Creating new samples

trans-unit.source: If you wish to add a code sample:
trans-unit.target: If you wish to add a code sample:

trans-unit.source: Your sample **must be part of a buildable project**
trans-unit.target: Your sample **must be part of a buildable project**

trans-unit.source: Your sample **cannot be a Visual Studio Project**
trans-unit.target: Your sample **cannot be a Visual Studio Project**

trans-unit.source: We do not want Windows and Visual Studio to be a dependency for people building these on their own.
trans-unit.target: We do not want Windows and Visual Studio to be a dependency for people building these on their own.

trans-unit.source: The only exception is if your sample highlights particular tooling and is referenced by a topic that explains the prerequisites.
trans-unit.target: The only exception is if your sample highlights particular tooling and is referenced by a topic that explains the prerequisites.

trans-unit.source: Your sample should conform to the [corefx coding style](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/Documentation/coding-guidelines/coding-style.md) to maintain consistency.
trans-unit.target: Your sample should conform to the [corefx coding style](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/Documentation/coding-guidelines/coding-style.md) to maintain consistency.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, we prefer the use of `static` methods rather than instance methods when demonstrating something that doesn't require instantiating a new object.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, we prefer the use of `static` methods rather than instance methods when demonstrating something that doesn't require instantiating a new object.

trans-unit.source: We will eventually have a CI system in place to build these projects.
trans-unit.target: We will eventually have a CI system in place to build these projects.

trans-unit.source: To create a sample:
trans-unit.target: To create a sample:

trans-unit.source: File an [issue](https://github.com/dotnet/core-docs/issues) or add a comment to an existing one that you are working on it.
trans-unit.target: File an [issue](https://github.com/dotnet/core-docs/issues) or add a comment to an existing one that you are working on it.

trans-unit.source: Write the topic that explains the concepts demonstrated in your sample (example: `docs/standard/linq/where-clause.md`)
trans-unit.target: Write the topic that explains the concepts demonstrated in your sample (example: `docs/standard/linq/where-clause.md`)

trans-unit.source: Write your sample (example: `WhereClause-Sample1.cs`)
trans-unit.target: Write your sample (example: `WhereClause-Sample1.cs`)

trans-unit.source: Create a Program.cs with a Main entry point that calls your samples.
trans-unit.target: Create a Program.cs with a Main entry point that calls your samples.

trans-unit.source: If there is already one there, add the call to your sample:
trans-unit.target: If there is already one there, add the call to your sample:

trans-unit.source: To build and run your sample...
trans-unit.target: To build and run your sample...

trans-unit.source: Restore dependencies
trans-unit.target: Restore dependencies

trans-unit.source: Go to the sample folder and Build to check for errors.
trans-unit.target: Go to the sample folder and Build to check for errors.

trans-unit.source: Run!
trans-unit.target: Run!

trans-unit.source: Add a readme.md to the root directory of your sample.
trans-unit.target: Add a readme.md to the root directory of your sample.

trans-unit.source: This should include a brief description of the code, and refer people to the article that references the sample.
trans-unit.target: This should include a brief description of the code, and refer people to the article that references the sample.
